name: Signature at MGM Grand

Service was impeccable from the check-in (bellman brought me water as the concierge checked me in) to the turn-down service at night (Fiamme chocolate on the bed, Belgian chocolates and glass with bottled waters on the night stand).

reviews.title: Dont hesitate - just book it.......

reviews.title: Totally Wowed by the Signature and the MGM Grand

reviews.title: Great Experience at the Signature

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed at the Bellagio last time I was in Vegas. Bellagio's pool is more elegant, restaurants are better, but you can't beat the deal and the suite. And Joel Robuchon is in the MGM Grand just a 10 minute walk through the walkway.
reviews.title: great place , no gambling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have mixed feelings about our stay at the Signature. There is no doubt the hotel is excellent value for money. There is also no problem with the location in my opinion - it is NOT a long walk to the MGM Grand and its casino and restaurants, or to the monorail or to the strip. I can't believe anyone complains about this.
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings

likes.disliked: — Service wasn't great and loud music was annoying

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our issues with the Signature are possibly a bit fussy but anyway, here goes:
reviews.title: Extremely Happy 15th Wedding Anniversary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. It was our honeymoon, of which we made the hotel aware. We had requested a room with a strip view (I know this is a bit unrealistic given the location of the Signature!) but we were not granted this request. We did not get any kind of room upgrade. We did not even have a balcony. We were left a Signature branded greetings card to welcome us, and a glass with FOUR chocolates in, some chocolate shavings and some berries. I just think this is a little cheap. I almost would have rather had nothing. I know you shouldn't expect any extras for your honeymoon but reading other reviews of people getting upgrades etc, just a little disappointing.
reviews.title: Great Stay at the Signature!!!

likes.liked: — The quiet, the privacy and the service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. When we arrived, we were asked if we needed help with our luggage. We said yes, thinking this was the done thing. We were met with a slighly exasperated look. reviews.title: a haven of peace and luxury in a crazy city

likes.disliked: — resort fee which was just an extra charge for nothing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled on business

reviews.title: Nice surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The good: Obviously, the room. Getting a free upgrade to a penthouse suite without asking for it is always nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is nice if you want "privacy" on the Strip, but that leads to .....
reviews.title: LOVED THIS PLACE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bad: The location. First off, don't go to the main MGM entrance thinking you can check in to the Signature there. No, you have to go ALL the way to the back, enter a security door, then take about six miles of walking escalators to get the Signature's entrance and check-in. OK, it's not six miles, but it feels that way. It's really an out-of-the-way hotel. But that's what it was designed to be.
reviews.title: Loved it!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love the MGM Grand. I stay there almost every time I go to Vegas. The addition of the Signature just adds to the enjoyment. It's a great place to stay to get an off-Strip feel and still be on the Strip. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

reviews.title: We Loved The Signature !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After getting our room key and all checked in we headed up to the 12th floor to our Junior Suite #12619 which was located at the end of the hallway away from the elevators, it was very quiet. reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Signature is three towers separate from the main MGM Grand casino/hotel but connected via a walkway (takes approximately 5 minutes to walk from one to another). The room we stayed in was a one bedroom suite which was excellent on all counts. The benefits of The Signature are a separate check-in from the main hotel which avoids the normal Vegas check-in throng, private pool and bar for each tower which affords uncongested sun bathing and valet parking. The service and advice from the concierges was excellent as were all the staff who were extremely helpful and polite. The MGM location is also good being directly at one end of the strip.
reviews.title: Loved the Signature
Would have been perfect but...
reviews.text: This is not the typical Las Vegas hotel - no slots in the lobby - you can get to your car (valet parking - no self-park) without going through a casino, but the MGM Grand casino is a 10 minute indoor walk away, and the monorail station is even closer.

All the fixtures and amenities were top quality - huge towels, Egyptian cotton linens, three (count 'em, three) flat screen TV's.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited the hotel during the crazy 7/7/7 weekend. Even though the hotel seemed to be sold out we received great service. Since we were staying for several nights we liked the fact that the room came with a small fridge so we could snack left over items.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business

Whenever we called the concierge we were helped 110%. They booked us last minute show tickets, Dinner reservations and returned our rental car.
reviews.title: great luxury, quiet hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Okay now to the car part... we rented a car from the airport since we were going to do a lot of driving for this vacation. My husband went to pick up the car for a short trip and noticed when it was driven up that it had front end damage. At first they didn't know what we were speaking of, then after security was called they reviewed security tapes and saw that it came in w/o damage the night before. They tried to make it up by providing us w/ a dinner credit of $200.00 and returning the car. Turns out they returned it late and MGM has the rental car place at the main hotel. Their insurance company called a few times when I don't understand why; I had insurance from the rental car location and it was their fault written on the report that they should of received BUT they didn't. The last hour before checkout we were dealing with this issue writing a report etc to be turned in with the car but the rental car place never received it. It was a pain for several days especially once we returned home and trying to get people on the phone to solve this problem they caused by crashing our car and trying to lie about it. I can't blame this on the valet department, the head of the valet at the time was a great guy he assisted us as much as he could. He even called in a town car to take us to the airport. He was a big reason why we loved the hotel and would ask for the same tower when we return. Even though the problems caused many headaches after our stay I will be staying at The Signature in the future. The walk is just perfect to the MGM not too far at all. You end up near the train, spa and pools...perfect. The food in building two was just yummy. Loved our stay!!
reviews.title: Everything Under One Roof

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had been told that all hotels in Vegas are amazing, wherever you stay. We searched the internet and read all the reviews on Trip Advisor before deciding on the Signature and we were not disapointed at all. The reception is classy and plush, without a hint of the tacky Las Vegas that we were expecting. The room was large with kitchen and large bathroom and like other trip advisors we found the bed extra comfortable!! We stayed in tower two and yes the walk to the main MGM was a little way it wasnt a problem, unless you realised that you had forgotton something and had to walk back!I We had under-estimated the amount of walking that you do in vegas and so definatly wear comfortable shoes. MGM itself is unbelieveable, better than we could ever imagined but after a night spent at the tables it was nice to go back to a quieter hotel with no bustle and calls of 'wheel of Fortune'. We made the trip out to The Wynn which was the other contender for us to stay in, and although the hotel is extremley plush it was very expensive to eat,shop and play anything.$100 spins!! We also paid a visit to The Rivieria (set of the film Casino) This is the place to go if you want to see and experience old time Vegas. The casino is smaller, they have a lounge singer entertaining you while you play and the croupiers very friendly. The bathrooms are like walking into a 1950's film set!! Whilst playing at the tables got talking to people who visited the Riveria throughout the year and watched as they were treated like family by the staff. The Signature is situated behind the MGM and you have to walk through there to get out to the Strip, about a 15 min walk one way takes you to the Luxor and Mandaly Bay and 10 mins the other way gets you at the Bellagio and Ceasers Palace. We saw O at the Bellagio and I would totally recommend that as the show to see. Book tickets before you go as they sell out completley!! On the subject of shows inside the Coco-Cola shop, situatued next to the exit of MGM is a place called Tix-4-Tonight. They do exactly that, discounted tickets for shows and restaurants for either that night or the next dayWe managed to get tickets for the David Copperfield show (which isnt as cheesy as you would think) from there at $30 off the listed price! I could go on for ages about who amazing Vegas is and to be fair any hotel that you choose will blow your mind. We were more than happy with the Signature and on our trip back(yes weve planned it already) we will be staying there again!! Oh, there is a great discounted shopping outlet in a place called Primm, this is advertised in the guide books as being on Las Vegas Blvd. It isnt. Its a 50 mile journey,as I went alone I got a taki-BIG MISTAKE. It ended up costing $100. Managed to get on the shuttle back which is free for MGM residents.which id of known about that before and had extra $ for shopping!! Any questions that you have please ask, like i said I could talk for hours about how out of this world Vegas is.A Giant adult playground!!
reviews.title: Fantastic!! Amazing!

likes.disliked: — The feeling of falling that you keep getting after using the lift!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I have had the opportunity to stay in many luxury hotels and this is up there with the rest of them. I was shocked when I read the review below from our fellow tripadvisor member from London, I wondered if we had stayed at the same venue. I cannot imagine what that person was complaining about. The rooms are beautifuly decorated in a contemporary modern chic decor. The bed is so cozy I didn't want to get up. The bathroom is all marble with an amazing jacuzzi and a mini flat screen TV. You have the pleasure to be connected to the MGM hotel/casino (which by the way is the beginning of the strip on Tropicana Ave) but at the same time the Signature is disconnected enough from the noise and craziness which is all to often associated with Vegas. Please don't let a couple of bad apples ruin it for the rest of you. I have stayed at hotels in other cities who claim to have luxury status however their rooms are the size of matchboxes. Their value is zero because the currency it takes to book that room is double the US dollar. They say that pictures speak a thousand words and this one doesn't lie. I wish you all great luck in Vegas... enjoy the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellence & Luxury In Sin City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: After making reservations two months previously for our anniversary trip with our three grown children in tow, we finally arrived at the MGM Grand in Las Vegas at 10:45 p.m., January 2. We stood at the check-in counter for 45 minutes while staff "looked" for rooms for us. Finally we were offered $135 in comped meals at the buffet (which was already closed) or the lobby restaurant. We chose, of course, the restaurant since we had already been told it would be at least another hour before our rooms were ready. Half past midnight: we get two of our three rooms. The third is promised in another 40 minutes. We check back for the third room at 1:30 a.m. and are told it would be another 40 minutes. We check back again at 2:30 a.m. and are told the room is ready. Upon entering the room, we find it hasn't been touched. We wait in the hallway while the maid cleans the room and finally occupy it at 3 a.m. Okay, the rooms were great but we really felt like we should have received more compensation than a comped meal while we waited over 4 1/2 hours for rooms that were reserved and paid for two months previously! Our mutual decision was that staying at the MGM Grand was history for us. Next time we visit Vegas it will be to stay in a different hotel with hope for considerably better service.
reviews.title: Great hotel but poor service!

The service at the signature was great particularly from the valets and pool staff and at the end of a busy day walking the strip, shopping or going to shows it was nice to come back to a quiet and peaceful hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the Signature at MGM. Our suite was spacious and exceptionally well equipped with a kitchenette area with above average quality utensils and equipment. The shower and the bath were big enough for anyone and the bath had a jacuzzi. There are 3 towers, one benefits from a cafe/restaurant which is ideal for breakfast whilst one of the others has a pleasant little bar. The pool areas were also very nice, safe, and well equipped. The real beauty of this hotel is that it is a few minutes walk (along a covered walkway) from the hubbub of the casinos and restaurants so therefore gives you the feeling of peace and tranquility. Personally we thought Las Vegas was the tackiest place we have ever come across, but I guess everyone should try it once and make their own minds up.

The quality of the staff and the attention given was first-rate, although there was a wait at the front desk the three times I needed to go there.

Maybe we are tidier than the average guest?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This being my 6th trip to Las Vegas (im 23years old), We decided to try a new hotel. We usually stay at the Mandalay Bay and The Hotel at The Mandalay Bay. We arrived Thursday Morning at about 11am, and were given an early check in. (which was nice not having to wait for our room to be ready). We had 2 rooms right next to each other, it was nice becuase there was a main door to a little room, then 2 doors to each room (each with E-Key entry). When I checked in, I was informed that my total was more than I was quoted, this was due to the Resort Fee $15 per room, per day. I informed them that i was quoted total price with all charges, including restort fee. Since it was a mess up on their part (wrong quote) they gladly waived the restort fee. Having stayed at the Suites at Mandalay Bay (THE HOTEL) I must say i was very impressed with the rooms. The Gym facility was very nice too have, get a nice work out before hitting the pool, and trying to work off some late night / early morning food runs. Anyone who says its a far walk to the MGM and MGM pool is very missunderstood, From tower 1 it was a 2 min walk (unless your 140 years old). I would say for the Average Person (not 20 something year olds like us) it would take no more than 5 mins to get there. We didnt opt to go to the private pools at the Signature, We are guys in Las Vegas, we came to see girls, so we went to the main pool at the MGM facility. The pool is VERY NICE, I injoyed this pool better than the pool at Mandalay Bay (and that was previously my favorite). reviews.text: We recently stayed at the MGM signature from 10/27 to 10/31. We had requested Tower 3 on a high floor facing the airport, which was granted upon checkin, in fact, they put us on the 36th floor (the top 10 floors are considered the penthouse and the ceilings are so high!). The view of the mountains was amazing (especially the sunrise), and the noise from the airport did not bother us one bit. The room was awesome! Bed and sheets were comfortable, jacuzzi was great after working out or walking the strip, and the appliances came in handy for so that we didn't have to go out to eat for every single meal. The towels, the robes, the huge shower, the clean room...this was by far the best room I have ever stayed in, and I've been to Vegas numerous times. My fiancee and I used the gym every day, which hardly had any people in it, and they supply you with water, headphones, apples and towels. We headed over to the pool (only tower 2 pool was open), but there were plenty of chairs available and they were very comfortable. Alot of people complain about the walk to the strip, but after staying in other Vegas hotels, the walk is better since the hallways are smoke-free and you don't have to walk 1/2 mile through a noisy casino. Also, on Tower 3, you can walk directly onto Harmon and it will take you to the strip in about 10 minutes. Getting a cab to the airport was easy. Again, they took care of everything!

reviews.title: Quiet and Smoke-Free
reviews.text: Overall, this hotel exceeded our expectations. The service was amazing; everyone was professional and was happy to help us (even got a late checkout last minute). The only issue, which was minor, was there was definite wear and tear in the room. The carpets had a couple stains, the window drapes had stains, which looked like pizza sauce, and the mirror had a crack in it. Again, these were minor, but given that this building is less than 2 years old, hopefully management will not let things like this go because everything else in this place is top notch. If you want a clean, nonsmoking, modern room with many amenities, which is close enough to the strip action, but far away that you can escape it, you should stay here. It's great for a relaxing romantic getaway! If you want to be part of the action on the strip, or are looking for a wild party scene, I wouldn't stay here. We would definitely stay again.

reviews.text: Arrived at Signature via limo arranged through Signature Concierge (call reservations and ask for concierge). We requested a high suite tower one and got exactly that. 32 floor.
reviews.title: Oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was only 1 pm but room was ready immediately and bags were brought up within 5 mins of us opening the door.
reviews.title: perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Room was spotless. Never heard any noise all the time during our visit. we found 2 bottles of water were not enough (we were doing a lot of walking) and left a note for housekeeping on arrival at the room we found 8 bottles had been left and housekeeping kept these topped up.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Toiletries were replaced or topped up every day, regardless of the use. little things like toilet paper were never left to run low and every day housekeeping folded the corners and embossed the signature logo onto it.
reviews.title: Save your money!

likes.disliked: — Lacking overall service that you would expect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Grab an apple from the lobby area..they are free and there for you to take. Anytime we were outside, ie wating for a taxi or returning via harmon avenue the valet staff would rush to open doors and offer you cold water.
reviews.title: Nice Suites, great location

likes.liked: — Space in ther suite and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel and this was our 2nd visit.
reviews.title: Excellent!

likes.liked: — the space, the kitchen, the comfortable beds, chairs etc

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Ignore all the silly comments about it being too far away. It takes 3-4 mins max from tower 1 to get to the mgm complex and they even have moving walkways to help get you there - I will never understand people who make this comment. You were given legs for a reason!!!
reviews.title: Three Generations at the Signature: a great time had by all!

likes.liked: — Proximity to everything with just enough distance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This time we stayed in a one bedroom suite whereas last year we stayed in a junior suite. We loved the added comforts of the extra rooms. We had two bathrooms (one smaller and then the usual massive one with jacuzzi etc). Everything still looks immaculate and the furnishings are very comfortable. They provide everything you need in the kitchen and our suite even had a dishwasher not that we needed it though (I think that is for long stay guests)
reviews.title: Loved the Signature!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Front desk can be a little temperamental. We preferred the bell staff as they were always friendly and efficient and ready to help. concierge are also very helpful. I just think the actual receptionists need a little customer service training.
reviews.title: Great, quiet hotel.
great property!! stay away from Luxury suites International
reviews.text: We highly recommend this hotel and for the money you get so much more. for the same price as we paid which was about $235 plus tax we could have stayed in a tiny room at the Bellagio. I would rather stay here and get all this space - the kitchen is particularly useful - coffee maker, cooker, hob, fridge, freezer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only in Vegas can you stay in a truly top quality 1 bedroom suite for $150 per night!
reviews.title: Only In Vegas..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room resembled a top quality apartment, TV in bedroom that comes out of the desk was quirky, however got a bit tedious after a while. DVD player did not work very well either, but we only used this for an hour or so as you don't visit Vegas to spend all day in your room (sorry suite).
reviews.title: Why Stay Anywhere Else?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved the balcony, never known a hotel balcony over 20 storeys up before, great view of the strip (especially at night). Full kitchen area was completely stocked with everything you needed to eat comfortably, wi-fi worked very well - included in the $20 per day resort fee, along with 2 bottles of water per day, coffee facilities and access to the fitness centre. Some hotels are trying to lobby against resort fees (particularly Planet Hollywood) but with the good rate we got, I didn't mind it too much.
reviews.title: Vegas BABY!!!
Outstanding Vacation at the Signature
reviews.text: The main bathroom was fantastic and jetted tub was great after a day (and night) out on the strip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: When you do make it to MGM you are near to the monorail, however we didn't really use the monorail this time. Unless you are headed to Stratosphere area, at $5 each one way, if there are more than 2 of you a cab is generally going to be a cheaper option (the bellhop at the tower reception will call one to come round).
reviews.title: Go to Vegas, just to stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: we've just returned home from a 7 night family holiday in vegas with our 11 year old daughter and stayed at the mgm signature. wow.... what a lovely hotel. it's friendly, clean, smoke free and gamble free. perfect if you want to see vegas with a family. the rooms are big enough for a family of 4 to comfortable stay in. the hotel doesn't have a restaurant but we didn't find this a problem there are sooo many places to eat out on the strip. we stayed in tower 1 the closes to the mgm grand, there is an air conditioned link between the mgm grand and ALL 3 signature towers. many people have reviewed that the walking distance between the grand and signature is too long and too far. we timed it at approx 5 mins from tower 1( we did this walk at least four times a day ) and it was never a problem. don't go to vegas if your not prepared to walk the place is huge. (but brilliant). we saw several shows that were child friendly and free attraction are plentiful. we found that the people on the strip giving out adult only cards did not bother you as soon as they saw you were with a child. the strip is very very busy at the weekend but there are plenty of places to go as a family away from the young party people if you organise your trip. The resort fee people mention is common place in most of the hotels, but if you want a quality hotel and service the signature is well worth it. We wouldn't hesitate to return,
reviews.title: who ever said vegas wasn't for families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on a road trip and needed a place to stay in Las Vegas for the night. We used TA to select the Signature. Called directly and specified a room with a view of LV and higher up in one of the towers. When we arrived they registered us in room 817 on the 31st floor. It was great. While the base price is very reasonable for a suite of rooms ($119) be aware there are four non-negotable add ons. Room tax 12%, Resort Fee ($20) and Resort Fee Tax also 12%. 35% higher then the base price although I suspect all the larger hotels have a similar policy. Even at $155 it was very good value for the money.
reviews.title: Another 5 star rating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed here over spring break in a one bedroom suite and the hotel was great. The room was plenty big for three people and it was nice having Wi-Fi in the room. For the most part, being set back from the strip was nice, but the walk back to the hotel got tiring after a long day on the strip.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our second stay at the Signature after a couple of abortive attempts to find something better in Vegas. Our family (2 adults and two teenage children) stayed in a one bed apartment during July 2010. The apartments are around 950 sq ft and beautifully appointed. The large bedroom has a massive kingsize bed and a large en suite bathroom with jacuzzi bath and separate toilet. The apartment itself has a full size pull out bed, easily big enough for two, a full size kitchen and a separate shower room. There is a large balcony too, with views either over the strip or over the desert.
reviews.title: Perfect accomodation and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is quiet, but only 400 meters from the strip, via the MGM Grand lobby, or more directly from the gate next to the swimming pool area of tower 3..
reviews.title: Signature @ MGM Grand - Fabulous!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A whole lot of luxury for a bargain price. Hard to top this hotel in every respect. New building, great hotel pool, away from the noisy strip and casinos but yet near enough to walk to. The 15 dollar daily charge for hotel facilities was worth it in the end, considering the services that provided (Wi-fi, fitness/pool facilities, free parking). Absolutely beautiful bathroom, complete with jacuzzi. A wonderful start to my 2 week holiday!
reviews.title: Great start to holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for 7 nights in Nov 07 and then for 6 nights in April 08 and I would love a reason to go back to LV just to stay here again. I absolutely adore this hotel. It is fantastic value for money. The rooms are huge, clean, has its own cooking facilities (which is great if all you want is a slice of toast, bowl of cereal). The bathroom is great with its jacuzzi, huge shower.
reviews.title: Best hotel in the world

likes.liked: — Everything about the hotel - room, gym, etc

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of my fav memories is watching the boxing in the jacuzzi with a bottle of bubbly on the TV in the bathroom while the balcony doors were open and we could see the hotel where the real live boxing was taking place (we also watched all the limos coming and going taking all the stars).
reviews.title: Amazing view!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I honestly cannot fault this hotel in any way. Even the distance from MGM to the hotel is approx 5 minutes and is helped with moving escalators. There is nothing better than walking through the noise and buzz of MGM and slipping through the side door to peace, calm and serenity. Heaven!!!!!
reviews.title: MGM Signature was great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Signature for one night on our honeymoon and wished we'd stayed longer! We had a junior suite which was massive and included a jacuzzi. The hotel even provided us with a bottle of champagne and chocolates to welcome us on our said. We would definitely recommend staying their although can't comment on the pool and other facilities as we were only there for the one night.
reviews.title: Stay at the Signature! - You'll love it!

likes.liked: — I felt really spoilled at the Signature. It's a bit of affordable luxury.
likes.disliked: — The resort charge because we only used the water.

reviews.title: Tower 1 - a brilliant oasis of calm!
reviews.text: We have recently returned from a 7 night stay in Signature at MGM Grand. Tower One to be precise. The reception staff were all welcoming, friendly and very accommodating which is important after a long flight and they maintained a very high level of customer service throughout the entire stay.

reviews.title: Fabulous Signature
reviews.text: Tower 1 reception is a delight - the other two Towers are the same. Very high quality spec, spacious and airy. An oasis of calm sophistication without a slot machine in sight ! Fresh flowers, fresh fruit and a regular supply of cooled, bottled water are available for those who have to wait.

reviews.title: Awonderful getaway
reviews.text: The Jnr Suite that we booked was perfect. Spacious, well equipped and with a breathtaking balcony view of The Strip. Very large en suite bathroom and separate loo was a good touch as well.

reviews.title: Terrible customer service
reviews.text: Light breakfasts could be taken in Starbucks (Tower 1), something a bit more substantial in 'Delightful' (Tower 2) - great quality, very helpful and attentive staff, or a short walk away to the Grande Buffet in the main MGM hotel which is an all you can eat for $14.50 per head - great quality food if somewhat hectic but you won't need another meal until the evening!

reviews.title: Nice but don't pay extra for a balcony
reviews.text: The Strip is just 12 minutes walk from Tower 1 through the main MGM Hotel and the journey from our room to the Mandalay Bay using that route, then over the bridges to Excalibur via New York New York and onto the Excalibur Express railway (yes truly!) to Mandalay Bay took under half an hour.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Very good choice if you are looking for good accommodation in hotel that is not casino hotel but still on the Strip.
reviews.title: Excellent value for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I just stayed at the Signature MGM with a couple buddies for a 4 day weekend get-a-way. Rooms were extremely nice, and clean. We stayed on the 22nd floor, facing airport and mountains. I'd have liked to stay with a strip view next time, but oh well. Staff was very accommodating and friendly. There was a "people moving" walk-escalator that made 3 minute walks to the MGM casino a breeze. Breakfast at tower #2 (all 3 towers are connected) was great!
reviews.title: Close enough to the fun, yet far enough for quiet!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms easily slept 3 people. 1 Bedroom Suite was luxurious. It was very nice to have all that space. Also, I liked that the Signature was non-smoking. Pools seemed busy, though we were too busy playing cards and doubling our retirement fund. :)
reviews.title: Great place to stay

likes.liked: — The rooms and the friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I would definitely travel and stay at Signature again.
reviews.title: Really Nice Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a non strip hotel then this is the one to stay at. Linked to the MGM Grand via a walkway it is very easy to reach the strip. Not sure why people have complained about the walk. In Vegas everything is a walk! Get over it.
reviews.title: Faultless..... : )
The Best!
reviews.text: Just got back from 4 nights at the Signature. Before we booked, we were leaning towards staying at one of the casino hotels - Bellagio, MGM Grand, Venetian - but a friend who had just returned from Las Vegas recommended the Signature very highly, so that's where we booked.

reviews.title: Our home in Vegas
reviews.text: We are very glad that we did! While the hotel is very close to the strip - a 5 minute walk - it seemed miles away from the hustle and bustle which was a very welcome retreat after a day of sensory overload.

reviews.title: Simply Outstanding
reviews.text: At check-in, the staff was very accomodating and the room was ready when we arrived, well before the 3:00 p.m. check-in time.

reviews.title: Incredible Stay, Yet Again
reviews.text: The room was large and conveniently had a microwave, bar fridge and cooktop, and the cupboards were stocked with plates and cutlery for the days we chose to snack in the room rather than have breakfast at a restaurant.

reviews.title: Far from the madding crowd
reviews.text: Housekeeping was outstanding, as the room was spotless after their visit each day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 7-4 thru 7-8 in a studio suite w/kitchenette in tower 1 on the 37th floor with a nice view of the strip. All of the rooms are actually timeshare condos with kitchens/kitchenettes and are equipped nicely dishes, linens, flat screen tvs, etc. King size bed in our room was quite comfortable and we had linen service everynite of our stay (4 nites). The room was pretty clean-under the bed I found dust bunnies and upon searching couch cushions I found crumbs/food in and under the couch which did not come from us! I still would say that overall it is a clean and upscale stay. You can't beat the price either. We booked thru tripadvisor and avg. was $100 per nite. One thing that did bother us was the pool at Signature only stayed open until 7pm. Almost every place we have ever stayed it is at least 10pm. You can use MGM pool facilities with your Signature stay at n/c but again-they also close at 8pm. It was 106 in Vegas-after being out all day exploring and then to dinner, a dip in the pool would have been an excellent option.?! Would I stay here again --ABSOLUTELY! A quiet and peaceful non-gaming facility of this class was a definate plus in Vegas for us!
reviews.title: Nice Stay-3 blocks walk to heart of strip-2 blks to Miracle Mile Shops

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Signature at MGM is a superb hotel. It is located directly behind the MGM Grand Hotel & Casino with a direct breezeway to the MGM Grand Casino & Restaurant Shops. The Signature is all suites with tremendous views of the Strip and really all of Las Vegas. I was located on the Penthouse 33 floor which was outstanding. Didn't spend too much time in the room but the Viking refrigerator and Miele Appliances looked fantastic with the black granite countertops. Service was fantastic as it should be in a world destination like Vegas. Best feature of all was the exclusive Starbucks adjacent to the lobby which in the mornings was not busy like the one in the MGM. Another great feature is that guests of the Signature may use both the pools at the Signature and the main pool at the MGM Grand-Wet Republic. Fantastic accomodations. Vegas is much better when you stay at a hotel without smoking or gaming so you can get your fill on the Strip then come back and relax with no distractions.
reviews.title: Upscale Chic Hotel Suites right off the Strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed three nights in June
reviews.title: Well-adjusted people, Good for families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The fact that this is a non-gambling hotel and more upscale makes _all_ the difference. You see well-adjusted people and families in the pool/hotel instead of the jungle that is the MGM. Just peek at the MGM pool to see what I'm talking about.
reviews.title: Wouldn't stay anywhere else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed in a Jr. suite with two small children.
reviews.title: Great Value and Absolutely Satisfied with the Service of the Hotel and the Managing Company

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Awesome hotel!!!! We originally booked the Junior Suite but when we checked in they upgraded us to penthouse!! Beautiful hotel/apartments rooms are decked out with a full kitchen and utensils, we caught a taxi to the nearest grocery store and stocked up on food/drinks and alcohol enough for the duration of our stay which saves you a lot of money eating out all the time which we found quite pricey. Staff was so friendly and helpful at all times. Fitness centre was fantastic and provided with towels and free water. All three towers are linked together with MGM and easy to walk around. A bit far from the actual strip but we didnt mind at all, easy to get by cab and back. After seeing all the other hotels and casinos we definitely thought The Signature was the best to stay in. Wet Republic at MGM Grand is a must to go to if you have to go to one day pool party! Just get yourself on a guest list! Would stay here again in a heatbeat!
reviews.title: best place to stay in Vegas!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The signature was all and more than I had hoped for from reading other reviews. We stayed in tower one on the 27th floor in a junior suite with a wonderful view of the strip. The walk to and from the MGM was short (3 minutes from lift doors to top of MGM stairs) and with moving walkways and scented air-conditioning it was a pleasant change from the smoky atmosphere elsewhere. Pool at tower one was quiet and we were served with complimentary sample iceddrinks and iced water which was a nice touch. MGM pool was crowded but also a change from the quiet when needed. Amenties in the suite were top class and allowed us to eat in room with cold milk and drinks on hand from fridge. Minor downside was the fees of 20 dollars per day for water and wi fi but as we were aware of this it was not a surprise. Wi fi was quick and useful to stay in touch with home when needed. To sum up I cannot see us staying anywhere else if and when we return and even checking out the entrance of tower 2 looked even nicer than 1 which in itself was excellent. Staff all helpful andp pleasant, no complaints whatsoever!!!
reviews.title: Magnificent splendour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the MGM Sig for 6 nights recently and loved this hotel. Unfortunately our stay was marred by issues with our booking. We booked through a so called "verified owner" with positive reviews from "verified reviewers" found on Flip Key. Thankfully their listing has now been removed from Flip Key. We only ended up getting 4 our of 6 nights booked for us, had to wait for a confirmation number each day and check out and back in each day as he did our reservation on a day by day basis instead of booking us in for 6 nights. 2 days he made no reservation and sent us no confirmation number - so we had to pay again for those 2 nights.
reviews.title: Great hotel in an excellent location - just be careful who you book through

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That aside the hotel was great, fantastic rooms with a great view and friendly staff. In particular we would like to thank Jacqueline from the front desk for being ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC, she definitely went above and beyond the call of duty trying to help us. We've given the 5 stay service rating with her in mind. She even called us with an update in her own time after finishing work and was the only staff member who made the effort to try and figure out what was happening with our bookings (not that I can hold that against the rest of the staff as it was not the hotels problem).
reviews.title: Still great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend staying at this hotel but be very wary if booking through a private owner as it sounds like there are several scams out there involving the MGM. We will definitely be booking straight through the hotel next time, this is the first bad experience we've had booking through an owner but after this have decided it's not worth the risk! Do not book though anyone using email address [-]. I think his name is Adam Miller.
reviews.title: Wonderful Honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I visited the Signature for Memorial Day weekend. We were celebrating his birthday and wanted a relaxing, romantic trip.
reviews.title: The Signature Doesn't Disappoint

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Signature delivered. We arrived at 11am and were checked in quickly. We received a strip view room on the 19th floor of Tower 2. Nice view of Planet Hollywood and Paris as well as the pool below.
reviews.title: A Really Lovely Hotel

likes.liked: — cleanliness, amazing amenities, location, non-smoking facility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was huge. Hands down, our favorite feature was the double jacuzzi tub. We still miss it!
reviews.title: Birthday Treat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area was also much bigger than I expected. And it wasn't at all congested like the pool at MGM -- I really wanted to try the lazy river, but it was soooo crowded we didn't bother. There are two hot tubs at the Sig pool -- both were empty almost all the time. There's also food and beverage service, which was great as it was 100+ degrees.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

likes.disliked: — The smoke in the MGM walk through casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ordered room service one day. We woke up late after a night of partying. I was hoping for breakfast, but it was after 11am, so we ended up ordering lunch. It took about 20 minutes to arrive. Everything was hot and delicious.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

likes.liked: — NO casino, no smoke, great beds.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in Tower 1 which is the closest of the three to the MGM casino. We had a one bedroom suite on the 22nd floor and were very pleased with the accomodation and the price. While this suite might seem like more than two people would need, having a large kitchen/dining/sitting area and bathroom completely separate from the bedroom and its large bath area meant that my wife, an early person, would not be disturbed by my late night comings and goings.
reviews.title: For Healthy Walkers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The suite was kept very clean and when on the first morning housekeeping noticed the garbage disposal didn't work (previous tenents had thown bottle caps into it) a maintenance man appeared to fix it in less than a half hour.
reviews.title: Dude, where's my car?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the lines were short at check-in and three people were at the desk the wait was extremely long as it seemed all of the people in front of us had problems and the pleasent desk people were going to take as long as necessary to help resolve them, I think refering at least one of the issues to a manager would have been more considerate to those waiting behind. When it was our turn our reservations were in order and we were registered quickly. When I went out to my car at the valet parking to take care of our luggage the man there suggested that if we could mange to get it to our room by ourselves we would avoid sitting around and waiting for it. It was a useful tip and it really wasn't a problem for us.
reviews.title: Comfortable luxury at The Signature

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: A real issue for many people will be the length of the walk and the amount of time it takes to get to the casino. There are moving walkways that help get you to the Grand but once inside of it there is still a fairly long walk to get past the restaurants and into the casino itself and you pretty much have to go through the casino to get to the strip. I estimate it took between five and ten minutes from tower 1 to the casino entrance and about fifteen to the strip exit. My wife and I are in our late sixties and she has a bad knee, but as only moderate gamblers we saw it more as an inconveniece than a problem.
reviews.title: Bar none the best hotel in Vegas
A Cut Above
reviews.text: On the other hand as we were walking back to our suite we talked to a couple who actually took a cab from tower 1 around the block to the MGM Grand entrance. We didn't ask them what the cab driver had to say about that. The system for cabs at the Signature seems kind of spotty. When you ask valet to call one they send a message down to the gated entrance on Harmon Street. Then a light is turned on and passing cabs are alerted to the fact that a cab is needed. On our first night we were fortunate enough to walk out just as a cab arrived with a drop-off. On the second night we were told that there were three ahead of us and of course they had no idea how long we would have to wait. We elected to walk the fifteen minutes to the Grand entrance where there was a continuous steam of cabs serving a fast moving line.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Signature based on the excellent tripadvisor reviews and were not disappointed. The only dislike, as we were in Tower 3, was the long walk to the strip via the MGM grand - around 25 minutes. This became a little tedious after a few days, but cabs are immediately available outside any of the Towers ( they are not apparent, the Bell Man presses a button and they roll in a few seconds later!!). Near the end of our stay, I discovered it was much, much quicker to the strip by exiting the Signature hotel itself and walking down Harman Street - Ho Hum!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel and Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was extremely well equipped and the full sized fridge, coffee maker and hob meant hot and cold drinks in the room were no problem. Fantastic bathroom, as good as anywhere we have stayed (and we have been lucky enough to stay in some very smart hotels). Would be nice if evening turn down service was automatically provided, but to be fair, this is available on request. Valet parking service was brilliant as was the service around the pool areas.
reviews.title: Absolute Perfection!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Pool opening times were somewhat restricted (8am to 7pm), so if you like an early morning dip, there is no chance as the pool areas are locked up. Sunbeds nice and comfy and towels/water plentiful. On our travels around Vegas, it appeared that these limited pool hours weres not uncommon in other hotels and were even generous by comparison.
reviews.title: The place to stay for families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took a fantastic trip with Sundance Helicopters (the Grand Canyon sunset tour) which flew over Hoover Dam, landed in the Canyon for Champagne and snacks, flew back into the Vegas sunset and then flew over the strip at dusk - fabulous. A trip up the Stratosphere tower was also great. A visit to the top of the "Eiffel tower" at Paris is also a must, particularly at night as you can see the Belagio fountains from above.
reviews.title: 5th Time at the Signature ( says it all !)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The forum shops at Ceasars Palace are also a great experience as are the Dolphins/Lions/Tigers at the Mirage. We had a car and so drove out to Hoover Dam and did the tour into the Dam itself (about 45 mins each way. Fantastic trip, but suggest you arrive before 10.30am as the traffic when we departed was absolutely terrible. This will be massively improved once the new bridge opens. (Great Breakfast in The Coffee Shop Boulder City). We also used the Deuce bus, which at $7 per day was a bargain. They run every 10 mins or so.
reviews.title: GREAT!!! MUST STAY IN!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I usually don't quite get around to writing reviews, but I love TripAdvisor. We just got back from three nights at The Signature and I had to write a review because it was so great. We actually chose The Signature because of the #1 rating and reviews on TripAdvisor.
reviews.title: Possibly the best hotel I've ever stayed in!

likes.liked: — The service, the room, the quietness - just about everything.
likes.disliked: — Location is the only thing that's not outstanding, but it's not a bad location at all.

reviews.title: The best smoking non smoking hotel
reviews.text: We stayed during the week because the rates were the lowest and it worked out well to start our stay on Memorial Day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off, the front desk people at check-in and check-out were very nice, professional and helpful. Getting an upper-floor room in the tower of our choice (Tower 1) was not an issue. And the room looked toward the strip and the mountains. Very nice, though you will hear wind sometimes when you're on upper floors in Vegas hotels.
reviews.title: Brilliant getaway from the casinos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is connected to the MGM grand near the pool and studio walk area. There are moving sidewalks so you don't have to do a lot of walking. You are close to the noise, excitement, hustle & bustle of the MGM, but the great thing is that The Signature is nothing like this. That is what we loved. The MGM pools were crowded and noisy. We went there once or twice just for fun, but we truly enjoyed the elegant, uncrowded, quiet and serene Signature Pools. This was so great. There is also plenty of elegant outdoor furniture for talking and hanging out, even in larger groups.
reviews.title: Signature Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was beautiful. It was tasteful and nice all the way around. When we stayed at the Mandalay Bay, I felt the room was like an average Marriott, but the bathroom was amazing. At The Signature, the whole room was elegant, nicely trimmed and beautiful. One thing we loved was instead of do not disturb signs, there are electronic buttons that display out in the hall with your preferences for housekeeping. A woman goes around and checks these lights and then dispatches the housekeeping staff. There was never constant housekeeping noise out in the hall in the mornings like some hotels.
reviews.title: Nearly superb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just spent a long weekend at the Signature. What a GREAT HOTEL in Vegas!
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As many reviewers have said, a very pleasant surprise to find a hotel in Vegas that is non-smoking, no gambling, quiet and upscale. The rooms are well and above just about any regular room found in Vegas. We stayed in a Junior Suite (for $159 a night) that had a king bed and a sleeper sofa (we didn't use since only two people). Room had a full kitchen - refrigerator, microwave, stove-top, toaster, blender, coffee maker and all the appropriate silverware, dishes and utensils. Bathroom was huge with double vanity, 4'x4' separate shower stall and a two-person whirlpool tub.
reviews.title: Nearly perfect
Awesome!
reviews.text: After reading previous reviews, at checked-in (in Tower 1) we requested to be on a Penthouse floor so that we could have a balcony. We were put on the very top floor (marked UPH on the elevator button) with an airport view. Upon entering the room we were surprised to not find a balcony. We called the front desk and they informed us that not all penthouse rooms did have a balcony. We asked if it were possible to change rooms to one with a balcony - and they honored our request with no questions. We were then put in Tower 2 on the 24th floor. So please IGNORE the advice about asking for a penthouse floor room to get a balcony. Just ask for a room with a balcony when you check in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Also - ignore the previous postings about no coffee filters for the coffee makers. After reading that review, I brought some filters with us - just to be prepared. They are not needed. Both the regular and decaf coffee came already prepacked in a filter - maybe the previous reviewer had not seen this before? Or maybe the hotel has changed the coffee set-up.
reviews.title: Signature Suites were sweet

likes.liked: — the safety and location of the property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Signature IS a long way from the main part of the MGM Hotel and a long way from the strip entrance of the MGM. But the walkway to the MGM does have three moving sidewalks - so it is not that bad at all. The walkway ends very close to the monorail station at the MGM - so it is a breeze getting around all of the casinos/hotels.
reviews.title: An Oasis of Sanity and Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I booked our stay through a private condo owner via vrbo.com. We had a wonderful junior suite over the July 17-19 weekend which was very well maintained and easily booked (if you go to vrbo.com, look to listing #134472).
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our check-in process was simple, the car valet was no hassle, and our luggage arrived within ten minutes. The Signature is a welcome change from the usual Las Vegas hotel - crowded check-in lines, noisy and smoky lobbies and hallways, overused hotel rooms, and the overall feeling of being cattle. The lobby was quiet and pleasant, our room was very clean (we were thrilled to have a window that opens in Las Vegas), the bed was extremely comfortable, and the pool area was also clean and well-kept. We did venture over to the regular MGM pools (you can use them as well) but forgot about the filthy floors full of cigarette butts, nasty people drinking beers and smoking in the pools, and the overall yuck of the pool water. Heading back to our own pool at the Signature made all the difference.
reviews.title: Love, Love, Loved The Signature!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the reviews I read on this site, I thought that the walk from the Signature to the MGM would take an hour - it was not a problem. If you've been in the MGM, you know what to expect or if you've been in an airport and have had to walk from one gate to another, you will not be shocked by walking from one building to the next. Really, it is no big deal. In fact, if you are really lazy, the entire walk is covered in people movers - you can stand the entire way. My only suggestions is bring a sweater - it is very chilly (again, not a problem).
reviews.title: Fabulous!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For people that want to escape the Las Vegasness of Las Vegas (meaning the smoke, lack of daylight, and extreme noise), this is an ideal hotel. You can enjoy the fun, kitchiness, and all-night part of the city but then head back to a nice, relaxing, charming hotel.
reviews.title: Another great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently went to Las Vegas to celebrate our 4 year anniversary. During the first half of our trip we stayed at another hotel and until we checked into the Signature at MGM we had not been pleased with our visit. When we first arrived at the hotel we knew that we would enjoy our stay. Check in went well and the young lady at the front desk was very professional but I wouldn't say overly nice. Our room was in Tower 3 on the 24th floor, prior to arriving we had requested a room on a high floor and they obliged our request. We reserved a Junior Suite and we were very pleased. The huge seperate tub and the shower was a nice touch and we had a great view from our balcony.
reviews.title: Lovely Suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Signature at MGM Grand has three tower blocks and is located one block away from the strip. It is connected to the MGM Grand via an air conditioned walkway complete with moving floor escalator. It is approx a ten minute walk from the towers to the strip. Conveniently there is a monorail stop at the MGM Grand which connects you to the full length of the strip.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel - Great Place To Recover From The Strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was wonderful!!! The bed was amazingly comfortable, the lounge area was relaxing and we found the kitchen area useful. What a bathroom!!!!!! We had his and her sinks, a large walk in shower, a seperate room off the bathroom that houses the toilet and a jacuzzi bath thats easily big enough for two.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used the deli in tower 2 and found the food great but the service a little shabby. All other staff we dealt with were extremely accomodating. Starbucks is located in one of the towers. We used the pool at tower 2 most days and the pool was clean. We used the fitness center in our tower and found it to be very good. Towels and water were available upon entry.
reviews.title: The hotel and staff were absolutely great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We extremely enjoyed the fact that Signature at MGM Grand is not a casino. It was refreshing to leave the hustle and bustle of the strip and head back to our calm tower block. I would recommend this hotel to people that want to enjoy the many extremes of Las Vegas and at the end of the night, return to peaceful reality of your room.
reviews.title: Great room and excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned and it was perfect the rooms are really good everything you need inc hairdryer which saves you packing one ! and lovely bathroom products so you really don't need to pack shampoo conditioner or body lotion. We stayed on the 35th floor of tower 2 and the view is something else I have to confess I didn't look out to often but my partner did,it took about 10 min to walk through to the MGM which was fine for us then from there your on the strip and you can just go from hotel to hotel either walking or the Mono rail but we found out that the bus is $7 per day and just hop off on and on that which stops everywhere.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay - with some caveats

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed here for seven nights and could only describe stay as perfect. we were in tower three which is the farthest from the MGM, but still less than 10 minutes walk; which is nothing at all in Las Vegas.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The suite itself was spacious and clean, the bathroom a dream with a walk-in shower, huge bath and flatscreen tv.
reviews.title: Lovely - But Wear Your Walking Shoes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We received $300 resort credit when booking and we used this for MGM buffet, poolside drinks etc. The pools were never crowded and there were plenty of seating areas in the shade for when it got a bit too hot.
reviews.title: Do not book with BluechipVegas at Signature MGM Grand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to others and we will definately be back.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Vegas!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 3rd trip to Las Vegas, having only previously stayed at The Venetian. We chose the Signature based on current deals and TA reviews. The reception from security to the front desk staff was superb - very warm and welcoming. We were in Tower 3. The lobby's aromatherapy system was wonderful, we did nt find it overpowering at all. In fact, after returning at night from smokey casinos it was a nice change to smell something so fresh and pleasant. We checked in early, and got a top floor 1 bedroom suite. The suite was elegant, the bathroom was outstanding (loved the jetted tub). We had a view of the mountains and airport out one window, the strip out another. The pool (Tower 2) was very calm, beautiful and relaxing. The service was outstanding. An added bonus that we didn't know about until the last day was that Signature guests get VIP status in line for the MGM buffet - which saved us considerable time for breakfast one morning.
reviews.title: The epitome of service and style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Cannot add to lots of the others reviews really.
reviews.title: Wonderful, peace and quite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 6 nights in April in tower 1, while we renewed our wedding vows, rooms were lovely and roomy, view was excellent.
reviews.title: As relaxing as Hawaii with the excitement of the Strip minutes away

reviews.title: Everything will be compared to the Signature
Amazing "Girls Only" trip at the Signature
reviews.text: MGM buffet is really good value for money, America in NYNY is a good place to eat too. Avoid the Hilton buffet you definitely get what you pay for.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: As for the resort fee, I do not see why people complain it clearly states what it is going to charge before you check in, and when we did not recieve water for 2 days they took the charge off for the whole stay! Not that I minded anyway.

description: The Signature is a world within a world. As your private portal to everything Las Vegas, you're free to indulge in an incredible array of diversions – with one commonality: an elevated level of personalized service. So whether you're grabbing a drink at The Lounge or basking in the private luxury of your own poolside cabana, you'll experience a level of attention and dedicated service that's unsurpassed, right at the heart of the most exciting city on the planet. Truly, this is Vegas at its best.As your gateway to this most incredible of cities, The Signature puts you at the doorstep of Las Vegas' most amazing experiences. Our Concierge is just the person to open that door and show you the way through. Allow us to serve your every whim, from show tickets to procuring a table at that must-experience restaurant to making your golf reservations. And when you feel the desire to leave your tranquil escape for the excitement of Vegas, the gaming, nightlife and entertainment of the phenomenal MGM Grand is right next door.
